```{r,echo=F}

# This seems broken on Canvas... the fractions shows as LaTeX...

gcd2 <- function(a, b) {
    if (b == 0) a else Recall(b, a %% b)
}
gcd <- function(...) Reduce(gcd2, c(...))


while(T){
    ab = sample(2:12,2)
    a = ab[1]
    b = ab[2]
    c = sample(2:10,1)
    if(gcd(c(a,b))==1){break}
}

factorsA = numeric()
factorsB = numeric()

for(i in 1:400){
    if((a*c)%%i==0){
        factorsA = c(factorsA,i)
    }
    if((b*c)%%i==0){
        factorsB = c(factorsB,i)
    }
}

```




Question
========

Find the greatest common of `r a*c` and `r b*c`.


Solution
========


The factors of `r a*c`:

* `r paste0(factorsA,collapse=", ")`

The factors of `r b*c`:

* `r paste0(factorsB,collapse=", ")`

The greatest common factor of `r a*c` and `r b*c` is `r c`.
